Based on the genre preferences and movie title suggestions provided, I would recommend "Red" (2010) as a potential recommendation.
"Red" is a crime drama film that was released in 2010. The film stars Jaqueline Fleming, Bruce Willis, Bruce Willis, Morgan Freeman, Morgan Freeman, Michelle Nolden.
The plot of the movie revolves around Jack Stokes who is Sheriff Lamar' s right-Hand man. Mrs. Lamar receives a threatening letter from a gambler. He threatens to expose her former life if she does not persuade the Sheriff to give him free play.
Jack overhears the conversation. In the fight which follows, the gambler is accidentally killed. His gang tries to lynch Jack. He is released from prison by Mrs. Lamar, and escapes. At a deserted cabin he finds the real Tom, who has been badly wounded while holding up a stage coach. The sheriffs from the two towns arrive. Sheriff Lamar clears Jack, and Beulah decides that she would rather have Jack as husband than brother.
Overall, "Red" is a well-made crime drama film that has received positive reviews from audiences and critics alike.

Based on the user's preference cues, I would recommend "Princess Mononoke" and "Predators". 

"Princess Mononoke" is a classic animated film based on the manga series of the same name by Osamu Tezuka. The film tells the story of Ashitaka, a young man who is drawn into a conflict between a powerful forest deity and a mining colony known as Tatara. Through his journey, Ashitaka also encounters San, the Mononoke Hime.

"Predators" is an American science fiction horror film directed by Paul Verhoeven. The film stars Liam Neeson, Gary Sinise, Alesha Victoria, and Michael Rappaport.

"The Last Airbender" is a 2010 American epic fantasy martial arts film directed by Zhang Yim. The film stars Dev Patel as Aang, the last surviving Avatar of the Hundred Years' War; Jackson Rathbone as Bao Gai, the general of the Tatar guards; and Aaron Taylor-Johnson as Ozai, the founder of the Fire Nation.

"Tombside" is a 2016 American crime drama film directed by David Fincher. The film stars Dana Delany as Ellen Foster, who is hired to investigate the disappearance of her sister, Sarah Foster.

Based on your preference cues, I would recommend The English Patient.
This classic film is set during World War II and follows the story of a young nurse named Anna (Juliette Binoche)) who tends to an old patient who has been burned by a shell fragment.

As Anna takes care of her patient, she also tries to come to terms with her troubled private life.

The English Patient is a beautiful and moving film that explores themes of love, loss, and the enduring power of human connection.
